alert.note: Alert for Boise Mountains; Lower Treasure Valley; Southwest Highlands; Upper Treasure Valley (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Boise (Southwestern Idaho and Eastern Oregon)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 08 at 6:43PM MDT by NWS Boise
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Ada, southwestern Boise, southwestern Elmore, eastern Canyon, central Owyhee and south central Gem Counties through 730 PM MDT... At 642 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Middleton to 10 miles southeast of Big Horse Basin Gap. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Grand View, Chalk Hills, Hinton Reservoir and C J Strike Dam around 650 PM MDT. Bruneau, Mountain Home Air Force Base, Bruneau Canyon Viewpoint and Hot Spring around 700 PM MDT. Boise, Mountain Home, Hidden Springs and Winter Camp Butte around 710 PM MDT. Horseshoe Bend, Pot Hole Butte, Bogus Basin Ski Area and Lucky Peak Dam around 720 PM MDT. Glenns Ferry, Harris Creek Summit, Deadman Flat and Aldape Summit around 730 PM MDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Boise Mountains; Lower Treasure Valley; Southwest Highlands; Upper Treasure Valley
